complete_backup.title: Complete Backup
complete_backup.description_prefix: Download a complete backup containing database, notes and attachments for
complete_backup.use_case_restore_text: Import this backup to recover your data in case of loss
complete_backup.use_case_offline_text_suffix: to browse your notes without Poznote

structured_export.title: Structured Export
structured_export.description: Export your notes organized in folders that match your Poznote folder structure. Each note will be saved in a directory that corresponds to its folder in Poznote, preserving the full hierarchy. Markdown files include YAML frontmatter with metadata.
structured_export.warning: Note: This export type is not designed for a perfect Poznote backup.

spinner.preparing_long: Preparing backup... This may take a few moments.

login.admin_warning: Please log in with the username {{username}} and your password (stored in .env). You can then rename this account in settings for better security.

errors.oidc_disabled: Your account has been disabled by an administrator. Please contact them for more information.

restore_from_backup.title: Do you want to restore from a Poznote ZIP backup file?
restore_from_backup.description: Restore your Poznote database from a complete backup

standard_restore.title: Standard Restore
standard_restore.description: Choose a complete backup ZIP file.

direct_copy_restore.title: Restore when standard restore doesn't work (timeout if zip file is too large)
direct_copy_restore.step1: 1. Copy the file to the container:

individual_notes.title: Do you want to import HTML, Markdown, text files or ZIP archives?
individual_notes.description: Import individual notes (HTML, Markdown or ZIP) to a specific workspace and folder
individual_notes.frontmatter_warning: If an MD note contains a folder key in a front matter, this value will override the one selected below. You must therefore ensure first that the folder already exists, otherwise the note will be created at the root of the workspace.
individual_notes.zip_folders_description: If your ZIP contains folders, they will be automatically created as folders in Poznote, preserving their hierarchy (subfolders included).
individual_notes.files_info: Multiple files (max {{maxIndividualFiles}}) or single ZIP file (max {{maxZipFiles}} files). These limits can be changed,
individual_notes.description_html:
Import individual HTML, Markdown, text or JSON files, or a ZIP archive containing multiple files.

Title will be automatically created from filename (without extension), unless a title key is defined in a front matter for MD files.

Tasklists: .json files containing tasks arrays and .md files with checkbox syntax (- [ ] or - [x]) are automatically imported as tasklists.
individual_notes.helper: You can select multiple files at once (Maximum 50 files). Supported formats: .html, .md, .markdown, .txt, .json

import_confirm.title: Are you sure?
import_confirm.body: This will replace note titles, tags, search index and metadata, but not actual note content. This action cannot be undone.

complete_restore.title: Complete restore?
complete_restore.warning_large_html:
Warning: This file is {{size}}MB. Standard upload might be slow or fail for large files.

This will replace your database, restore all notes and attachments for all workspaces.
complete_restore.warning_html: Warning: This will replace your database, restore all notes and attachments for all workspaces.
complete_restore.body_html: This will replace your database, restore all notes and attachments for all workspaces.

import_notes.title: Import notes?
import_notes.body: This will import all HTML files from the ZIP. Files will be added to your existing notes collection.

import_attachments.title: Import attachments?
import_attachments.body: This will import all files from the ZIP to attachments folder. Files will be added to your existing attachments.

complete_restore_direct_copy.title: Complete restore (Direct copy)?
complete_restore_direct_copy.body_html: This will replace your database, restore all notes and attachments for all workspaces.

import_individual_notes.title: Import individual notes?
import_individual_notes.body: This will import notes to Poznote workspace.

public.password_remove_hint: Leave empty to remove password protection.

list.hint: Enable Kanban view on a folder to see it here.

search.placeholder_notes: Search for one or more words...
search.placeholder_tags: Search for one or more tags...

validation.select_type: Please select at least one search option (Notes or Tags)
validation.single_letter_warning: Searching with single-letter words can return too many results. Try using longer words for a more precise search.

github_sync.title: GitHub Sync
github_sync.description: Push your notes to GitHub or pull notes from an existing repository. One repository is equal to one profile. Workspaces will be folders at the root of the repo.
github_sync.warning:
Do not use this feature as your only backup solution.
Consider setting up manual or automatic ZIP exports of your notes.
github_sync.confirm_push: Push notes of workspace "{{workspace}}" to GitHub? Updates existing files and deletes files that no longer exist in Poznote.
github_sync.confirm_pull: Pull notes for workspace "{{workspace}}" from GitHub? Import notes from GitHub. Updates existing notes and moves to trash notes that no longer exist on GitHub.

config.title: Configuration
config.hint: GitHub sync is disabled. Set POZNOTE_GITHUB_SYNC_ENABLED=true in your .env file to enable it.

push.title: Push to GitHub
push.description: Export your notes to GitHub. Updates existing files and deletes files that no longer exist in Poznote.

pull.title: Pull from GitHub
pull.description: Import notes from GitHub. Updates existing notes and moves to trash notes that no longer exist on GitHub.

messages.push_success: Successfully pushed {{count}} notes, deleted {{deleted}} files ({{errors}} errors)
messages.pull_success: Successfully pulled {{pulled}} new notes, updated {{updated}} existing notes, deleted {{deleted}} notes ({{errors}} errors)

limitations.title: Synchronization Limitations
limitations.embedded_note: Embedded images are preserved in HTML but not displayed on GitHub

not_configured.title: GitHub Sync Not Configured
not_configured.description: To use GitHub synchronization, you need to configure your GitHub credentials in the .env file.
not_configured.step1: Create a GitHub Personal Access Token at github.com/settings/tokens with 'repo' scope
not_configured.step2: Create a GitHub repository (public or private) for your notes
not_configured.step3: Add the configuration to your .env file
not_configured.step4: Restart the application for changes to take effect
